name: HAT-P-39
scenarioDescription:
The HAT-P-39 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HAT-P-39 is a star with 1.4 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.62 times its radius. It is located 2093.92152 light years away from the solar system.

HAT-P-39 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HAT-P-39 system

HAT-P-39 b

HAT-P-39 b was discovered by the HATNet observatory using the Transit method. The mass of HAT-P-39 b is 190.372 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HAT-P-39 b is 17.609 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HAT-P-39 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system. At more than 50 Earth masses, HAT-P-39 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HAT-P-39, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by HATNet.
